                        <div id="content" class="site-content" role="main">
                            <article id="post-6" class="post-6 page type-page status-publish hentry">
                                <div class="entry-content">
                                    <!--h4 style="color: #2e4330;"><strong>Welcome to w4mpjobs</strong></h4-->
                                    
    <h1 class="entry-title">Welcome to w4mpjobs</h1>
    <p>Welcome to w4mpjobs, funded by the House of Commons to provide career development opportunities for those working for MPs and those who are looking for a job with an MP or in other areas of political activity.<span style="font-size: 0.8em;">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong>Looking for a job?</strong></p>
<p>You can search ads on the current system in the following ways:</p>
<ul>
<li><a title="View all jobs" href="../SearchJobs.aspx?search=alljobs">All current jobs</a></li>
<li><a title="Just view those paying NMW AND ABOVE" href="../SearchJobs.aspx?search=nmwandabove">Just view those paying National Minimum Wage (NMW)/National Living Wage (NLW) and above</a></li>
<li><a title="Just view UNPAID POSTS and those on LESS THAN NMW" href="../SearchJobs.aspx?search=unpaid">Just view unpaid jobs and those offering below NMW/NLW</a></li>
<li><a href="../SearchJobs.aspx?search=adsbeforexpirydate">Find ads withdrawn before their expiry date</a></li>
<li><a href="../SearchJobs.aspx?search=alljobsplusexpired">Search all ads including expired ones</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p><span style="font-size: small;">Volunteering Opportunities Overseas</span></p>
<p>We list overseas volunteering opportunities on our main site as these are not jobs and often require fundraising by applicants. <a href="http://www.w4mp.org/jobs-listings-events/jobs/volunteering-opportunities/" target="_self">See current opportunities</a>.</p>
<p><strong><span style="font-size: medium;">Advertising a job</span></strong></p>
<p>Adverts on w4mp are <strong>free</strong>. Please ensure that your posts are compliant with our <a title="Rules on ads we don&rsquo;t accept" href="http://www.w4mp.org/jobs-listings-events/jobs/advertising-jobs-with-w4mp/jobs-we-dont-accept/" target="_blank">rules on ads we don&rsquo;t accept</a> and with our <a title="Guide to submitting ads" href="http://www.w4mp.org/jobs-listings-events/jobs/advertising-jobs-with-w4mp/guide-to-submitting-jobs/" target="_blank">guide to submitting ads</a>. We reserve the right to remove any posts without further notice to you which, in our reasonable judgement, do not comply with the rules and guide.</p>
<p>If you need to make a change to an ad you have already submitted email us at <a title="Get in touch" href="mailto:jobs@w4mp.org" target="_blank">jobs@w4mp.org</a>. For changes to live ads please include the ad reference number.</p>
<p>Please don&rsquo;t resubmit your ad before its expiry date as this &rsquo;leap-frogs&rsquo; other ads. This is unfair to other advertisers and we don&rsquo;t allow it. You may, of course, resubmit an expired ad with a later starting date if you have failed to recruit.</p>
<p><strong>Unpaid opportunities on w4mpjobs</strong><br />We recognise that there is great value in people having access to proper work experience, where it is offered and arranged properly and is a mutually beneficial arrangement, but that this should never be used as a way of circumventing <a title="blocked::https://www.gov.uk/national-minimum-wage https://www.gov.uk/national-minimum-wage/who-gets-the-minimum-wage" href="https://www.gov.uk/national-minimum-wage">national minimum wage/living wage regulations</a>.</p>
<p><strong>A proportion of posts advertised on w4mpjobs are opportunities to volunteer, either with political parties or with charities. These are understandably unpaid but we reserve the right not to publish ads which we judge to take advantage of this.</strong></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: black; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 10.5pt;">Adverts for roles which are unpaid but which specify set hours and/or a set duration and which list tasks or give a job description more characteristic of a paid post are not voluntary roles, they are unpaid jobs. A truly voluntary role should be flexible.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: black; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 10.5pt;">We also expect adverts to adhere to the spirit and not just the letter of the rules governing voluntary roles and national minimum wage/national living wage. Implying that you are flexible about how many hours/days you expect when you really have a fixed view and will not interview those offering less means that you are offering an unpaid job, not an internship or voluntary work.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>

                                </div>

                        <aside class="widget widget_text" id="text-2">
                        <p><img src="Images/w4mplogo250.jpg" alt="w4mp logo" /></p>
                        
                            <p style="font-size:14px">This is the jobs section of w4mp, the Working for an MP website. w4mp is a resource for anyone working for a British Member of Parliament or with an interest in how Parliament works. Visit the main site at <a href="http://www.w4mp.org" target="_blank" title="Visit the main site at www.w4mp.org">www.w4mp.org</a>.</p>

                        <p><a href="http://www.w4mp.org/jobs-listings-events/jobs/advertising-jobs-with-w4mp/notes-for-agencies/" target="_blank">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notes for agencies</a></p>
